law.catch_line: Badges of railroad policemen -- Insignia of passenger train employees.

text.section: Each railroad policeman shall, while on duty, wear a metal badge or shield, with the words "Railroad Police" and the name or initials of the railroad engraved thereon. When acting as a detective in the service of the railroad, he may wear the badge or shield concealed.

Every railroad company shall require a uniform hat or cap and distinguishing badges to be worn by all its employees, other than engineers and firemen, whose duties relate immediately to the transportation of passengers.

law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 779, 779a-4.
